definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random

sentences.english: It blithely dismissed the open-letter's suggestions with a declaration of denial.
sentences.chinese: RIM發表聲明，草率地全盤否定了公開信的建議。

sentences.english: This open letter is to rebut the argument of abstractionism.
sentences.chinese: 這封公開信是反駁抽象派論點的。

definition: to learn of (an event)/to hear about (sth)
to bombard/to bomb/(fig.) to criticize/to roast
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
